data.name: accessibility-statement.instructions
data.value:
Conformance status

The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. The service is fully conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA.

Compatibility with browsers and assistive technology

The service is not compatible with:

  • Internet Explorer 9 and older
  • Safari browser on Windows computers

Limitations and alternatives

Despite our best efforts to ensure accessibility of the service, there may be some limitations. Below is a description of known limitations, and potential solutions. Please contact us if you observe an issue not listed below.

Javascript is required for the service to function properly.

Assessment approach

The Digital Services Factory assessed the accessibility of the service using:

  • WebAIM’s WAVE Evaluation tool
  • Google Chrome’s Lighthouse tool

Feedback and complaints

We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of the service. Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers when using it:

  • Email: dsf@dits.dmrid.gov.cy

We try to respond to feedback within 30 working days.

If we do not reply, or do not fix the issue, you can send a complaint to:

Deputy Minister of Research, Innovation, and Digital Policy
Vyronos 29 Avenue1096
Nicosia
Cyprus

Or you can email: info@dmrid.gov.cy

If you are not satisfied with their response, you can send a complaint to the Commissioner for Administration and the Protection of Human Rights (Ombudsman).

Date

This statement was created on 4 November 2022 based upon the W3C Accessibility Statement Generator Tool.

This is an accessibility statement for the XXXXX Department’s service ‘MOCK’.

data.value: Accessibility statement – [service-name_EL]

data.name: cookie-policy.instructions
data.value:
Cookies in use

All of the following cookies are deleted 30 minutes after you close your browser.

AppDataSessionCookie

This cookie stores a ‘session ID’ which is used to identify your browser session.

AspNetCore.Antiforgery

This cookie makes sure that information sent to the server comes from our form, and not elsewhere.

AspNetCore.Culture

This cookie stores your language preference.

DsfCyLoginAuthCookie

This cookie is set when you’ve successfully signed in using CY Login.

Using CY Login

When you sign in using CY Login (also known as ‘Ariadni’) to use this service, it will save additional cookies on your device.

How to control cookies

Find out how to control and delete cookies on your device.

You can delete all cookies that are already on your device and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work.

The ‘MOCK’ service (url) only uses cookies that are strictly necessary for it to function correctly.

data.name: no-valid-profile.instructions
data.value:
If you’ve signed in using a CY Login ‘organisation’ account, you need to return to CY Login and sign in using a ‘citizen’ account.

If you’ve signed in using a CY Login ‘citizen’ account, you need to make sure it’s ‘authenticated’. Find out how to authenticate your CY Login account.

data.name: privacy-statement.instructions
data.value:
This privacy policy explains how the XXXXX Department collects and stores information about you.

Types of information collected and used

XXXXX collects the following information from you through this website:

XXXXX collects the following information about you from CY Login:

  • your CY Login user name
  • your email address
  • your personal identification

XXXXX combines the information you provide in this service with information it already holds, including your:

  • name
  • date of birth
  • citizenship
  • postal address
  • phone number
  • email address

How your personal information is stored

XXXXX has created this service to make sure it has the correct and up to date versions of the information listed above. This is so XXXXX is able to successfully contact citizens of Cyprus when carrying out its work.

Your age and citizenship are used to check you’re eligible to use this service.

This information is captured and stored by your consent.

How your personal information is stored

Your information is stored securely on servers based in Cyprus.

Your rights

Contact dsf@dits.dmrid.gov.cy if you want to:

  • get a copy of the information held about you
  • withdraw your consent
  • restrict the processing of your data
  • correct or update your personal information
  • object to the processing of your personal information
  • have your information transferred to another organisation or to you

Complaints

You can complain about the way your personal information has been used by contacting the Office of the Commissioner for Personal Data Protection.

  • your preferred email address
  • your mobile phone number
